trans-unit.source: Retrieves the contents of the specified enhanced-format metafile

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the contents of the specified enhanced-format metafile

target.mrk: Retrieves the contents of the specified enhanced-format metafile

trans-unit.source: Returns a pointer to a memory block (buffer) that receives the metafile data.

seg-source.mrk: Returns a pointer to a memory block (buffer) that receives the metafile data.

target.mrk: Returns a pointer to a memory block (buffer) that receives the metafile data.

trans-unit.source: Optionaly, you can set this parameter to 0 before function call, then the function will allocate the required memory block itself.

seg-source.mrk: Optionaly, you can set this parameter to 0 before function call, then the function will allocate the required memory block itself.

target.mrk: Optionaly, you can set this parameter to 0 before function call, then the function will allocate the required memory block itself.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, it must be a valid memory pointer returned by the _WinAPI_CreateBuffer() function, or by previously calling this function.

seg-source.mrk: Otherwise, it must be a valid memory pointer returned by the _WinAPI_CreateBuffer() function, or by previously calling this function.

target.mrk: Otherwise, it must be a valid memory pointer returned by the _WinAPI_CreateBuffer() function, or by previously calling this function.

trans-unit.source: The number of bytes copied to the buffer.

seg-source.mrk: The number of bytes copied to the buffer.

target.mrk: The number of bytes copied to the buffer.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: After the enhanced-metafile bits are retrieved, they can be used to create a memory-based metafile by calling the _WinAPI_SetEnhMetaFileBits() function.

seg-source.mrk: After the enhanced-metafile bits are retrieved, they can be used to create a memory-based metafile by calling the _WinAPI_SetEnhMetaFileBits() function.

target.mrk: After the enhanced-metafile bits are retrieved, they can be used to create a memory-based metafile by calling the _WinAPI_SetEnhMetaFileBits() function.

trans-unit.source: When you no longer need the buffer allocated by this function, you must call the _WinAPI_FreeMemory() function (do not use any other memory routines) to release occupied memory.

seg-source.mrk: When you no longer need the buffer allocated by this function, you must call the _WinAPI_FreeMemory() function (do not use any other memory routines) to release occupied memory.

target.mrk: When you no longer need the buffer allocated by this function, you must call the _WinAPI_FreeMemory() function (do not use any other memory routines) to release occupied memory.
